description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the Windows TCP/IP information disclosure vulnerability (CVE-2024-38064), apply the following updates to your Windows systems:

1. Download the appropriate KB updates for your system version:
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2 (x64): [KB5040442](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040442)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 (x64): [KB5040427](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040427)
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2 (x64 & 32-bit): [KB5040431](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040431)
   - For Windows 10 for 32-bit Systems: [KB5040448](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040448)

2. Install the downloads following the prompts on screen.

3. Restart your system after the installation is complete to ensure changes take effect.

**Details**:
- These updates address the use of uninitialized resources within the TCP/IP stack, which could lead to information disclosure.
- Ensure you select the correct update based on your system's architecture and version.

**Preconditions**:
- Your system must be running a supported version of Windows 10 or Windows 11.
- Perform a backup of your system before applying these updates to prevent data loss in case of interruptions.
